column1: Jiguaní (Spanish pronunciation: [xiɣwaˈni]) is a town and municipality in the Granma Province of Cuba. It is located 25 kilometres (16 mi) east of Bayamo
The municipality is divided into the barrios of Babiney
column7: Rihito and Santa Rita.The name "Jiguaní" is of Taíno origin
column8: and means "height of the river". The town of Jiguaní was a stronghold and a starting point in the independence war of 1895.

column2: the municipality of Jiguaní had a population of 60
column3: 320. With a total area of 646 km2 (249 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 93.4/km2 (242/sq mi).
